definition: to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Our results cannot prove whether we have passed a tipping point or not.
sentences.chinese: 我們的研究結果不能證實我們是否已經通過了臨界點。

sentences.english: Is there some set-point which when crossed unleashes the evil?
sentences.chinese: 有沒有一個臨界點，當它被跨過之後就會釋放出邪惡？

sentences.english: South-South trade is beginning to acquire a critical mass of its own.
sentences.chinese: 南南貿易正開始達到自己的臨界點。

sentences.english: To cross our own tipping point and decide to embrace a future carbon-free world.
sentences.chinese: 超越我們自己的臨界點，堅決擁抱未來的無碳世界。

sentences.english: The subaffine elastica is the critical point of the total squared subaffine curvature functional.
sentences.chinese: 次仿射彈性曲線是全平方次仿射曲率泛函的臨界點。

sentences.english: The critical service life for rocket grain was presumed at present.
sentences.chinese: 目前藥柱貯存壽命失效臨界點一般都是假設確定的。

sentences.english: The modelsuggests Thwaite's glacier has also passed its tipping point.
sentences.chinese: 該模型認爲斯維特冰川也正在達到臨界點。

sentences.english: The nonlinear response functions near critical points often take the form of power law.
sentences.chinese: 在相變臨界點附近的非線性響應函數普遍遵守冪律。

sentences.english: Right now we are nearing that tipping point.
sentences.chinese: 現在，我們即將接近這一臨界點。

sentences.english: But as I approached the steep drop-off, I stopped and froze.
sentences.chinese: 但是當我接近險峻的臨界點時，我停下了，木立不動。

sentences.english: So the critical point drying method is better than the natural drying method for palynology research.
sentences.chinese: 進行孢粉學研究，臨界點乾燥法優於自然乾燥法。

sentences.english: However, if we reach this threshold they could be magnified instead, " said Betts."
sentences.chinese: 然而，如果到了臨界點，這種影響就會被放大。

sentences.english: And our gas-liquid line, with a critical point here.
sentences.chinese: 這是我們的汽液共存曲線，這裏是臨界點。

sentences.english: But the army says militancy is down to a “subcritical” level.
sentences.chinese: 但是軍隊稱交戰狀態已經降到“臨界點以下”的等級。

sentences.english: Buttoning Formula" is a metaphor for "forbidden fruit", and the critical point for "life and death.
sentences.chinese: 紐式“是禁果的一種隱喻，是”生死的臨界點。

sentences.english: That is how we look for critical points.
sentences.chinese: 這不就是我們找臨界點的方法嗎？

definition: (of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
turning point/breaking point/inflexion point (math., a point of a curve at which the curvature changes sign)
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
to approach (a numerical value)/to converge to a limit (in calculus)/convergence
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
